entry.title: Letitia Christian Tyler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Letitia Christian Tyler (depicted) was the first United States first lady to die in the role?

entry.title: Northeastern Army (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nationalist China's own Northeastern Army captured Chiang Kai-shek to convince him to end the civil war against the Chinese Communist Party?

entry.title: The Longevity Diet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 2018 book The Longevity Diet claims that a "fast-mimicking diet" increases lifespan and healthspan?

entry.title: #BlueforSudan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rihanna and Dua Lipa participated in #BlueforSudan to bring attention to the 3 June 2019 Khartoum massacre?

entry.title: 323P/SOHO (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the periodic comet 323P/SOHO approaches the Sun at a distance of 0.04 AU, nearer than any other numbered comet, every 4.15 years?

entry.title: La Voce della Patria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Berlin embassy of the Italian Social Republic published the weekly La Voce della Patria from 1943 to 1944 for distribution among Italian Military Internees in Germany?

entry.title: Francois Massaquoi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Francois Massaquoi, who studied economics at New York University, later led the Lofa Defense Force during the First Liberian Civil War?

entry.title: The Noble Fisherman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Noble Fisherman unusually places Robin Hood in the seaside town of Scarborough, and he ends up fighting French pirates?
